oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Stonewall Jackson's Last Words
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sheet music, entitled "Stonewall Jackson's Last Words." There is a sketch of the re-enactment of Jackson's last words.

Thomas J. (Stonewall) Jackson, a Confederate general during the Civil War, was probably the most well known commander next to General Robert E. Lee. Accidentally shot by a North Carolina regiment, he died of complications from pneumonia on May 10, 1863. Jules Meininger was a songwriter before and after the Civil War. He died circa 1911 in Nashville.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Meininger, J. C. (Julius C.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Jackson, Stonewall, 1824-1863; Confederate States of America; Meininger, J. C. (Julius C.)
